channel.title: Courses on Timur Ergen
channel.description: Recent content in Courses on Timur Ergen

item.title: Foundations of Institutional Theory (University of Bremen)
item.description: This seminar introduces theories of institutions from across the social sciences, covering classical origins through recent debates about institutional change.

item.title: Capitalism and Modern Society (University of Bremen)
item.description: This seminar explores central topics of political economy and economic sociology, from the origins of capitalism to theories on the relationship between capitalism and democracy.

item.title: The Ordinal Society (University of Bremen)
item.description: This seminar examines the effects of digital technologies on social orders, individuals and social inequalities, focusing on Marion Fourcade and Kieran Healy's concept of 'The Ordinal Society.'

item.title: Vorlesung Soziologische Theorie (University of Oldenburg)
item.description: This lecture covers fundamental sociological concepts and selected theories of the social, covering both classical and contemporary perspectives.

item.title: Soziologie der Klimapolitik (University of Oldenburg)
item.description: The seminar builds on the lecture in Sociological Theory, deepening central concepts and arguments through discussion of latest applications of sociological theory to the problem of climate change.

item.title: Soziologische Forschungspraxis (University of Wuppertal)
item.description: This seminar provides practical skills and reflective knowledge useful for conducting independent social science research projects, combining findings from interdisciplinary science studies with the philosophy and sociology of science.

item.title: Vorlesung Organisationssoziologie (University of Wuppertal)
item.description: This lecture introduces fundamental theories and concepts in organizational sociology, covering rationalization, bureaucracy, and various theoretical approaches to understanding organizations.

item.title: The Sociology of Markets (MPIfG/Sciences Po)
item.description: This intensive course provides analytical and conceptual tools to study markets from a sociological perspective, examining how markets are institutions interwoven with political, social, and cultural structures. Beyond covering the basics, the seminar explores recently vibrant research frontiers to discuss with students the future of the field.

item.title: Gesellschaftlicher Wandel und Gr√ºne Energie (University of Wuppertal)
item.description: This seminar introduces research on the transformation of energy systems, examining the political, social, and economic dynamics of sustainable energy transitions.

item.title: Foundations of Institutional Theory (University of Cologne)
item.description: This seminar introduces theories of institutions from across the social sciences, covering classical origins through recent debates about institutional change.

item.title: Innovation and Society (University of Cologne)
item.description: This seminar introduces social science perspectives on the origins, forms, and effects of innovation, examining where inventions come from how societies shape and are shaped by technological change.

item.title: Soziologie multinationaler Unternehmen (University of Duisburg-Essen)
item.description: This seminar examines the historical development, organizational structures, and societal impacts of multinational corporations through a sociological lens.

item.title: Economy and Society II (MPIfG)
item.description: This doctoral seminar focuses on recent debates on the interrelations between economy and society, examining economic action, markets, and modern capitalism.
